title: American_Top_40_July_4th_1970
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. Some are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this very first broadcast (which uses the data for the week ending July 11th, 1970):

With artists like the Moody Blues (you can hear the pops in vinyl record Casey plays), Mountain, Rare Earth, Blood Sweat & Tears, the Carpenters, Bread, Three Dog Night, Blues Image, and the Beatles (who are still together), its a great countdown.

Wilson Pickett re-does an Archies song.
One vocal group in the countdown has had 32 hits in the last 9 years.
One song has been a hit four different times in 19 years.
Casey remembers the 200th birthday of a man who has a piece of music in this countdown.
Casey also celebrates the 70th birthday of the man who stopped the Beatles.
Although the Grateful Dead would not have their first top 40 hit until August 15th, 1987 ("Touch Of Grey" made it to number 9), "Teach Your Children" (at number 24) by Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young features Jerry Garcia of the Dead on pedal steel guitar.
